hero.title: About EasyPicky
hero.subtitle: Lightweight joy through your browser. A web game platform accessible to everyone with no installation or complexity required.

introduction.title: What is EasyPicky?
introduction.content:
EasyPicky is a browser-based web game platform embodying the philosophy of 'pick easily, play lightly.' Without complex installation processes or heavy programs, you can experience moments of joy anytime, anywhere with just a browser. We believe accessibility is the beginning of enjoyment.

Modern life flows quickly. Short breaks during lunch, commute times, brief pauses between meetings. EasyPicky was born for exactly these moments. No need to download heavy game clients or create accounts‚Äîgames start with a single click.

Our goal is simple: provide gaming experiences that anyone can access and enjoy. From students to office workers, from gaming novices to veterans, EasyPicky welcomes everyone. All you need is a browser.

All EasyPicky games are implemented with web technologies, providing identical experiences across PCs, tablets, and mobile devices. No need to worry about operating systems or device specifications. All you need is an internet connection and curiosity.

philosophy.title: Creation Philosophy & Vision
philosophy.content:
We focus on creating 'moments of fun.' Rather than flashy graphics or complex systems, we prioritize intuitive controls and clear feedback that allow players to quickly immerse themselves. Under the belief that games should be rest, not burden, we pursue designs that anyone can understand and enjoy within five minutes.

Accessibility and creativity don't oppose each other. Rather, we believe purer fun emerges from constraints. While acknowledging browser platform limitations, we experiment with physics engines, random algorithms, user customization, and more. Lightness and depth can coexist.

In 2025, the gaming industry grows increasingly heavy and complex. Dozens of gigabytes, high-spec graphics cards, paid subscription models. Yet many people still want simple, immediate fun. EasyPicky bridges this gap. Browser games aren't relics of the past‚Äîthey're future choices prioritizing accessibility and convenience.

Our vision is 'joy that starts with one click.' A platform where anyone can equally enjoy games regardless of language, region, or device. A culture where players customize games and create their own fun. EasyPicky isn't just a game site‚Äîit's a community sharing lightweight joy.

games.title: Featured Games
games.content:
Pinball recreates classic arcade nostalgia in your browser with physics-based gameplay. Control flippers to bounce the ball, hit bumpers and obstacles, and rack up scores in simple yet addictive fun. The custom map editor lets players design and share their own pinball maps, unleashing infinite creativity. The unpredictable movements and satisfying impacts created by the physics engine deliver experiences that never get old, no matter how many times you play.

Roulette is a selection tool based on fair random algorithms. It makes small daily decisions fun‚Äîchoosing lunch menus, drawing teams, deciding game orders. Freely customize participant names and colors, with rotation speed and result animations designed intuitively for anyone to use. Beyond simply picking results, it transforms moments of choice into events.

team.title: Team & Project Culture
team.content:
EasyPicky is a project built by a small team. Not a large corporate organization, but developers and designers united by passion to 'create something fun.' We value ideas over roles, collaboration over hierarchy. Respecting each member's expertise‚Äîfrontend developers, game designers, UX planners‚Äîwe maintain a culture prioritizing player experience above all.

Our philosophy: 'We create ideas, but players worldwide create the joy together.' Though small, our team listens to player feedback and improves quickly. While maintaining anonymity, we communicate transparently and constantly balance technical excellence with user convenience.

We don't make perfect games‚Äîwe make games that keep improving. Through regular updates and new features, EasyPicky evolves as a living platform. Community opinions become our development roadmap, and each small suggestion becomes seeds for the next version.

feedback.title: User Feedback & Recognition
feedback.content:
Since launch, EasyPicky has received positive responses from many users. Hearing stories like 'great that I can play instantly without installation,' 'perfect game for lunch breaks,' 'used roulette to decide team dinner menu'‚Äîknowing EasyPicky accompanies small moments in daily life brings us the most fulfillment. Especially with praise for customization features, a culture of creating and sharing beyond mere consumption is forming.

Tech communities are also noticing EasyPicky's approach. The physics engine implemented purely in browsers, responsive design, and optimized performance receive positive evaluations. User reviews often say 'lightweight but not flimsy,' 'simple but never boring'‚Äîprecisely aligning with our direction. We'll continue listening to players' voices and providing better experiences.

contact.title: Contact & Community
contact.content:
More information about EasyPicky is available on our official website and blog. We regularly share new game updates, feature improvements, and development stories. Your opinions and suggestions are the driving force making EasyPicky a better platform.

Open your browser right now and experience EasyPicky. No installation or signup required. Lightweight joy starting with one click awaits you.

introduction.title: Pinball Game Introduction
introduction.content:
The thrill of the ball bouncing, the scoreboard climbing. EasyPicky Pinball brings the nostalgia of classic arcade games to your browser with physics-based gameplay. Realistic movement powered by the Planck.js physics engine, a custom map editor to design your own layouts, and real-time leaderboards for competitive play. No installation, no account required. One click is all it takes.

The core of this game is 'unpredictable fun.' Even on the same map, the ball's trajectory changes every time, and the physics created by rotating obstacles and bumpers present a new challenge with each play. More than just a browser pinball game, it delivers the immersion and impact of a true physics engine game. Your strategy and timing determine your score.

A 5-minute lunch break, a moment before a meeting, or a game night competing with friends. Pinball is ready whenever you are. The challenge for the highest score, creativity unleashed through custom maps, and the tension felt on the real-time leaderboard. Everything is possible with just a browser.

howToPlay.title: How to Play
howToPlay.content:
**Enter Participants**: In the game control panel, enter participant names separated by line breaks or commas (,). Add `*number` to set weights, e.g., `John Doe, Jane Smith*3, Bob*2`. Names can be up to 8 characters long. Higher weights mean more balls for that participant, increasing their chances of winning.

**Select Map**: Choose from various custom maps beyond the default. Click the map selection button (üó∫Ô∏è) to open the map modal, where you can sort maps by name (A-Z), reverse name (Z-A), or creation date. Click a map card to preview and load it. Each map has different obstacle layouts and difficulty levels‚Äîtry them all!

**Winner Selection Mode**: Decide who wins when the game ends. Choose from First Place (highest score), Last Place (lowest score), Custom Rank (3rd, 5th, etc.), or Top N Places (multiple winners at once). Great for raffles or team games.

**Speed Control**: Adjust game speed with the slider. Set between 0.1 (slow) and 0.5 (fast) across 5 levels, with 0.3 (normal) as default. Slow speed suits strategic play, while fast speed delivers intense gameplay.

**Start and Reset**: Press 'Start' to drop balls from the top of the map, one per participant. During the game, check current rankings on the real-time leaderboard. When all balls reach the goal, the winner is announced, and you can choose 'Play Again' or 'Play Without Winner.' The 'Reset' button returns the game to its initial state.

**Leaderboard and Minimap**: The top-right displays real-time rankings, while the top-left shows a minimap of the entire map. The minimap highlights the current camera view and ball paths, so you never lose track of the action on large maps.

**Fullscreen Mode**: Click the fullscreen button (‚õ∂) in the bottom-right for an immersive game environment. Press ESC to exit fullscreen.

visuals.title: Game Screen Layout
visuals.content:
EasyPicky Pinball's screen is intuitive yet information-rich. The central game canvas displays the physics engine's real-time ball movement, where rotating bars and obstacles create unpredictable trajectories. The impact of balls hitting bumpers and the satisfaction of reaching the goal are conveyed through clear visual feedback.

The top-right features a fixed real-time leaderboard showing participants' current scores and rankings. Color-coded names and scores update continuously during gameplay, instantly revealing who's in first place or who just made a comeback. The top-left minimap shows the entire map structure in miniature, highlighting the area currently in view. It's an essential UI element that helps you track ball positions even on complex maps.

When the game ends, spectacular fireworks animations accompany the winner's name displayed prominently in the center. This visual presentation goes beyond simple result announcements, maximizing the celebration and sense of achievement. The winner screen offers two buttons: 'Play Again' and 'Play Without Winner,' allowing you to jump straight into the next round.

introduction.title: Roulette Game Introduction
introduction.content:
What's for lunch today? How do we pick teams? Who goes first in the game? You don't need to struggle with small daily decisions anymore. EasyPicky Roulette is a fair random selection tool powered by unbiased algorithms, transforming simple draws into exciting events.

Customize participant names and colors freely, and adjust probabilities with weighted entries. Choose rotation speed from weak, normal, or strong, and watch stunning animations announce the results. No installation, no account required. With just a browser, you can turn the moment of choice into an event right now. Fair, intuitive, and most importantly, fun.

howToPlay.title: How to Play
howToPlay.content:
**Enter Participants**: In the left settings panel, enter participant names into the textarea (#roulette-names-input). Separate names by line breaks or commas (,), and add `*number` to set weights. Example: `John Doe, Jane Smith*3, Bob*2`. Names can be up to 8 characters long. Higher weights increase that participant's roulette section size, boosting their winning probability.

**Shuffle Button**: Click the 'üîÄ Shuffle' button above the participant list to randomly reorder all entries. A toast notification appears at the bottom of the screen to confirm the change.

**Sort Button**: Click the '‚ÜëaA Sort' button to arrange participant names in ascending alphabetical order. Click again to toggle to descending order. After sorting, a toast notification displays the sort direction.

**Speed Selection**: In the rotation speed section, choose from 'Weak', 'Normal', or 'Strong'. The default is 'Normal', easily changed via radio buttons. Your selection affects the roulette's spin duration and suspense level.

**Start Roulette**: Once settings are ready, click the center canvas (#roulette-canvas) to spin the roulette. At least 2 participants are required; if insufficient, a toast notification will alert you. During the spin, colorful sections rotate rapidly while the top pointer indicates the final winner.

**Winner Screen**: When the roulette stops, a fullscreen overlay appears with fireworks animation (#roulette-fireworks-container) and the winner's name displayed prominently. Two buttons appear: 'Play Again' and 'Play Without Winner', letting you choose how to proceed to the next round.

**Remove Winner**: Click 'Play Without Winner' to automatically remove the previous winner from the participant list and start a new draw with the remaining people. Perfect for repeated draws.

**Fullscreen Mode**: Click the fullscreen button (‚õ∂) at the bottom of the screen to switch to an immersive gaming environment. Press ESC to exit fullscreen anytime.

visuals.title: Game Screen Layout
visuals.content:
EasyPicky Roulette's interface is both intuitive and visually rich. The massive game canvas in the center features a spinning circular roulette, with participant sections displayed as colorful fan-shaped segments. A fixed arrow-shaped pointer at the top clearly shows which section is selected when the roulette stops.

The left settings panel is the brain of the game. At the top, the title 'Roulette Settings' is displayed, followed by the participant input field. Above the input area, shuffle and sort buttons are placed side by side, allowing quick manipulation of the participant list with a single click. Below that, speed selection radio buttons are vertically arranged, letting you intuitively choose your desired rotation speed.

The winner screen maximizes the celebratory moment. A fullscreen overlay darkens the background as fireworks animation bursts spectacularly above. In the center, the title 'üéâ Winner! üéâ' appears alongside the winner's name in large text, with two buttons side by side at the bottom prompting the next action. Toast notifications at the bottom provide instant feedback for every user action, ensuring nothing is missed.

items.q: Can I exclude the winner and draw again?
items.a: Yes, absolutely. On the winner screen, click 'Play Without Winner' to automatically remove the previous winner from the participant list and start a new draw with the remaining people. Perfect for consecutive draws or order determination. Note: at least 2 participants are required.

Of course. EasyPicky Roulette features responsive design and works perfectly on all devices‚ÄîPC, tablet, and smartphone. Tap the canvas on touchscreens to spin the roulette, and use fullscreen mode for enhanced immersion.

Participant colors are automatically assigned, with each participant receiving a unique color. Colors are consistently applied to roulette sections and winner name displays, making it visually easy to distinguish who won.
